physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a man. He is seated and looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. He adorns robes and a headdress. The floor is carpeted and the background suggests that this photograph was taken in the interior of a building.
sgcool_label_text:
This studio portrait shows a seated man dressed in Chinese official robes. The studio mark of J. B. Jasper is stamped on the back of the photograph. 

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
title_text: Studio portrait of a seated man in Chinese official robes
subject_terms_1: studio portraits men (male humans) ceremonial robes
subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Portrait photography Men Robes
